thread.title: S&P support levels are key for investors
thread.title_full: S&P support levels are key for investors - MarketWatch

author: By     Simon Maierhofer
title: S&P support levels are key for investors
text:
For over two years, analysts and “investment pros” have been calling for a market crash, or correction. When will it actually show up?
Here is just a small selection of fear-monger headlines published over the last two years:
Jan. 25, 2013: " Why S&P 1,500 may signal stock rally has peaked " — CNBC
Nov. 6, 2013: " Key sentiment indicator flashes danger warning for stock market " — Investor's Business Daily
Nov. 14, 2013: " The bubble is getting bigger and bigger " — USA Today
March 28, 2014: " Get ready for stocks to drop 25% " — CNBC
May 27, 2014: " Beware: 2014 looking a lot like 2007 " — Yahoo!Breakout
Jan. 31, 2015: " Stocks are flashing a major sell signal " — Yahoo!Finance
May 22, 2015: " Stocks and bonds will crash soon " — CNBC
June 9, 2015: " Get ready for a 4000 point Dow drop " — MarketWatch
A watched pot never boils. Or more correctly, the water is more likely to start boiling once you look away (and occupy yourself with something else). The stock market has been like a watched pot (especially for premature and impatient bears). It just doesn't roll over (as it's “supposed” to).
But even a broken clock is right twice a day. No doubt, at some point, the market will correct (more than 10%) or crash. But when?
The market will crash when?
